> I haven't been following the Hydras plot, could I get a summary of what happened over there since Tuscon left the Maximal base (and then returned)?

Okay, I'll give it a shot - although a lot has happened. It is quite
long, and probably is missing a few things here and there. Sandy,
Airly, please feel free to correct any errors :)

Ahem!  Here we go . . .

Tuscon left the old maximal base  with the intent of rescuing Rodimus
Prime, who he at that time believed was being held against his will.

Upon arriving at Hydras' base Tuscon found that Cyclonus was also
there, unbeknownced to him having only arrived there a short time
earlier. Most likely due to the turmoil of Cyclonus' and Scourge's
arrival and Tuscon's own training, the Autobot was able to sneak into
Hydras' base unobserved making it all the way to Hydras' throne room.
It was there that Tuscon discovered Cyclonus, Scourge, Hydras,
Rodimus, Darkhawk and Perceptor having some sort of meeting, Cyclonus
and Scourge having just pledged themselves to Hydras.

In a failed attempt to rescue Rodimus, Tuscon ended up challenging the
very mech he was intent on recapturing to a duel - Rodimus. For
various reasons the other Predacons and Decepticons stepped back to
allow it to happen. However during the battle it seemed as if somehow
Tuscon was able to channel some sort of power, or something, and for a
moment he looked lot like Optimus Prime! With that Hydras himself
entered the fray and defeated Tuscon, leaving him apparently near
death. Hydras commanded that Tuscon be taken to the torture chamber to
find out what secrets Tuscon knew.

During this time Rat Trap, who presumably had been stationed at the
Ark wondered a bit too far from home - whether on purpose or choice
was up for debate -  found himself at Hydras' fortress. Somehow, as he
got near he was able to home in on Nightlight's energy signature and
went in to investigate. Sneaking in he was able to find his way
through Hydras' base, even to locate Tuscon, who he discovered during
his break in, he quickly hid himself in Tuscon's helmet.

During this time Perceptor pulled Rodimus away from the rest and had
him keep an optic on Scorponok/Zarak who he was comming to trust less
and less. It seemed that although he was an intelligent and capable
warrior, Hydras was not sure if the Decepticon did not have an agenda
of his own.

While Perceptor, Rodimus and others were distracted and Darkhawk and
Scorponok/Zarak were taking Tuscon to be interrogated, Rat Trap was
able to transform, inject Tuscon with a boost of energy, and both of
them, after a short scuffle with Darkhawk, were able to make a quick
get away, fleeing further into Hydras' base in an attempt to liberate
Nightlight, who Rat Trap had detected earlier.

However when they got to Nightlight they found her totally
unresponsive. Also at this time Tuscon's energy reserve that he had
gotten from Rat Trap began to flag as his levels dropped. As Tuscon
began to fall into stassis lock he gave Rat Trap his sonar/transmitter
so that he could some how effect his own escape and perhaps rescue the
others. And so Rat Trap fled into the venting system as the Predacons
arrived and recaptured Tuscon and took him away.

Cyclonus, Scourge and Perceptor move off to chase down the elusive Rat
Trap as Scorponok/Zarak and Darkhawk are again sent to finish the job
of interrogating Tuscon. Tuscon awakes to find himself strapped to the
torture device, as the two cons begin their interrogation of him.

Rat Trap continues to use the vent shafts and his small size to his
advantage, but Scourge and his superior tracking abilities allow him
to keep up with the fleeing rodent. It was during this time that Lord
Elder, who now noticed that Rat Trap had been gone for an extended
period called for him. After a short chat between the two, and a few
shots through the walls from Scourge that miss Rat Trap, Lord Elder
and a Maximal called Quickstride set out to rescue Rat Trap and
Tuscon. Rat Trap of course continues to flee, but now with the
determination to help Lord Elder rescue them all.

Meanwhile at the torture chamber Scorponok/Zarak and Darkhawk continue
thier attempts at interrogation on Tuscon, however the interrogation
proves fruitless as Tuscon is able to summon an, up to this point,
unknown energy reserve and is able to break free from the restraints,
and another battle ensues. Darkhawk and Scorponk call out for a lock
down.

At the same time Rat Trap is still on the run, creating all manner of
mayhem. Alarms start going off as apparently something he's done has
damaged the base's security. Perceptor orders Rodimus to go protect
Nightlight. As Tuscon finally bursts out of the door of the torture
chamber he meets up with Rodimus, who's path to the nearby Nightlight
had taken him past the room.

Meanwhile, Perceptor orders inner defenses and swarm bots in the
interior of the walls to marshal against Rat Trap. The ploy is
effective as Rat Trap is forced out of the venting system and ends up
near Tuscon's position. As Rat trap gives Tuscon back his
sonar/transmitter Tuscon now seemed ready to fight Rodimus, but with
Rat trap there all the other Deceptions and Predacons are quickly
closing in on their position things seemed to get a little dark.
Hydras, Perceptor, Scourge and Cyclonus arrive as Darkhawk and
Scorponok are themselves stepping out into a suddenly very crowded
hall. All seems lost for Rat Trap and Tuscon.

However it was at this time that Lord Elder and Quickstride arrive via
a Maximal shuttle. utilizing the entire fiepower of the shuttle
combine with the mayhem that Rat trap was able to create in the
fortress' electrical system they are able to temporailly shut down all
power to the fortress and for a few moments all goes black!

Quickly taking advantage of the situation Tuscon and Rat Trap flee,
Tuscon being far more adept in the dark that any of the others, with
the possible exception of Perceptor and maybe Scourge are able to make
a quick escape into the waiting maximal shuttle. However the shuttle
has itself been damaged in the forced landing it made during the
rescue, so the ride home is a bit rocky.

At the Fortress Hydras is visibly upset at the turn of events and
orders the base to be repaired, and also begins to look around for a
possible new security chief. Putting it off for the moment Hydras
tells Cyclonus, Darkhwak, Scorponok/Zarak and Scourge to begin repairs
on the base. Meanwhile Perceptor called Rodimus aside to assist him on
a special project: the reconfiguring of Nightlight.

Nightlight is remade, having no beastmode as of yet and no real
memories of who she is or was, Rodimus is assigned to help her
reintegrate and perhaps to help her choose a new beast mode. It is
determined that having her imprint on the Predacons will insure her
loyalty to them. Rodimus agrees, and it is obvious that despite her
lack of memories, and Rodimus' own swiss cheese memories, there is
still a connection of sorts between them.

While all this has been going on Cyclonus and the others have finished
the repairs to the base and Cyclonus noted that someone was able to
break in during the pursuit of Rat Trap and Tuscon, but he is unable
to determine who it is. Hydras commands Cyclonus to be sure that no
one else can. Cyclonus assents.

Meanwhile with the Maximal shuttle, it is forced to land due to the
damaged it had sustained. It is determined that Quickstride and Rat
Trap will head to the old Maximal base to help out with the Minions
there while Lord Elder and Tuscon will head back to the Ark. Tuscon
transforms into vehicular mode, and they all leave the Maximal shuttle
behind.

Tuson and Elder quickly make it back to the Ark, where after a bit of
discussion Tuscon began to hear voices coming from presumably from the
Matrix, although no one else is able to hear them. This calls for some
heave soul searching on the part of Tuscon who sits down.

All the maximals at the Ark get together and began to devise a way to
rescue Rodimus as well as Nightstrike and Darkhawk, who also it seems
used to be a Maximal. While this conversation is going on Lord Elder
notes a sensor ghost on his scanners. Sensor logs shows it has been
there for quite some time, although he can get no sensor lock on it.

At this time Nightshift, a near twin and old buddy of Tuscon was
apparently serving at the old Maximal base when decided to come see
Tuscon. At the base and during the drive it is revealed that
Nightshift could change signatures, appearing as a Predacon or
Maximal. This caused some confusion at the old base when he had
forgotten to turn his siganture back to Maximal, and again when he
arrived at the Maximal base when he showed up as a Predacon. However
he shifted it to Maximal when he neared the Ark and Tuscon came
outside to greet him and introduce him to the other Maximals.

A quick plan was hatched to get him inside the Predacon base using his
espionage skills and ability to switch signatures. So after a short
set up the plan was put into motion and a mock battle began between
Tuscon and Nightshift, with Kup coming out as well. Nightshift put in
a call to Hydras

Meanwhile at the Predacon base this had gone well. Repairs were
complete and Nightlight seemed to be doing well. But the conflict at
the Maximal base had not gone unnoticed. Their own sensors went off as
they wondered what was going on. Hydras came to the security section
at Cyclonus' request and it was they that they got a bird's eye view
of the battle, as it was obvious that Cyclonus had someone or
somehting watching the battle. What ever it was had recorded the
entire scene and plated back for a very suspicious Cyclonus. Hydras
also took in the same information and then ordered Cyclonus to secure
the research section of the base as he sent Scorponk to go pick up
Nightshift.

Scorponok quickly arrived on scene as Nightshift was 'finishing off'
Tuscon and left him in a heap. Kup was no where to be seen. After a
very short discussion the two drove off back to the base, with Hydras
sending orders to Scorponok to keep an eye on Nightshift as he himself
was suspicious of the whole thing. Tuscon and Kup, as soon as the
battle was over and Scorpnok and Nightshift were out of range went
back into the Ark.

Once back inside the Ark Tuscon was drawn back to Optimus Prime where
the voices again were heard, but now, to the surprise of all present,
the matrix transformed Tuscon into Tuscon Prime. After giving a few
orders, the new Prime took off for the old maximal base.

During this time Scorpnok 'escorted' Nightshift back to Hydras' base
and brought him the throne room where they were to await Hydras,
meanwhile he began to ask him a few questions himself. Meanwhile
Rodimus and Hydras were in the security room discuss Nightshift,
watching him on the viewscreen via hidden camera.

At this point Cyclonus cut in with vital information. Displaying an
image on a screen near Hydras, it showed a new version of Tuscon as a
Prime as he left the Ark. Obviously watever surveillance method
Cyclonus had been using was still in place as it was from the similar
angle.
